snippet: The federal government began notifying workers of expanded benefit eligibility for same-sex couples, and the Senate is expected to take up a measure against discrimination.
abstract: Federal government is moving quickly to extend benefits like health care and life insurance to gay and lesbian married couples in response to Supreme Court decision that struck down Defense of Marriage Act.
lead_paragraph: The federal government began notifying workers of expanded benefit eligibility for same-sex couples, and the Senate is expected to take up a measure against discrimination.

headline.main: Effects of Ruling on Same-Sex Marriage Start Rippling Out Through Government
headline.print_headline: Effects of Ruling on Same-Sex Marriage Start Rippling Out Through Government

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
